alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin; Jackson; Jefferson; Osage; Shawnee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 29 at 7:38PM CDT until March 29 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Franklin County in east central Kansas... Jefferson County in northeastern Kansas... Eastern Shawnee County in east central Kansas... Douglas County in east central Kansas... Osage County in east central Kansas... Eastern Jackson County in northeastern Kansas... * Until 815 PM CDT. * At 737 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Whiting to near Berryton to 3 miles east of Reading, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Topeka, Lawrence, Holton, Osage City, Carbondale, Valley Falls, Oskaloosa, Tecumseh, Richland, Overbrook, Lyndon, Centropolis, Perry, McLouth, Pomona, Meriden, Scranton, Hoyt, Ozawkie and Nortonville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 160 and 175. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 175 and 206. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Douglas; Franklin; Jackson; Jefferson; Osage; Shawnee
